description.hltext_display: Часть забот по финансированию деятельности РПЦ возьмет на себя специальный инвестиционный фонд
description.content:
В России будет учрежден первый эндаумент-фонд для финансирования деятельности Московского патриархата.
Фонд планируется создать в феврале 2011 года. Заработанные им деньги будут направляться на финансирование деятельности синодального (ОВЦС МП), на общецерковную аспирантуру и на развитие Ростова Великого. Об этом сообщил накануне порталу "Интерфакс-Религия" помощник по финансам главы ОВЦС МП митрополита Волоколамского Илариона, предприниматель Леонид Севастьянов.
По словам собеседника агентства, который участвует в создании фонда, цель - "сохранение прибыли в 10% годовых от эндаумента, то есть от суммы денег, которая находится в обороте".
"Мы уже привлекли 50 миллионов долларов, но мы рассчитываем на увеличение этого эндаумента в ближайшее время. Фонд создается по инициативе владыки Илариона и по благословению Святейшего Патриарха: можно сказать, что мы действуем строго в рамках церковного послушания и непосредственно руководствуемся пожеланиями Святейшего Патриарха", - сказал Л. Севастьянов.
Он отметил, что пока предполагается расходовать деньги в равных долях.
Говоря об общецерковной аспирантуре, Л. Севастьянов напомнил, что это новое учебное заведение Русской православной церкви. Часть средств будет направлена на зарплаты профессорам и стипендии учащимся, а также восстановление комплекса Черниговского подворья в центре Москвы, которое было передано на баланс аспирантуре Патриархом. Это комплекс, состоящий из трех храмов и двух разваленных зданий.
Отвечая на вопрос о том, в какие сферы будущий фонд будет вкладывать средства для извлечения прибыли, собеседник агентства заявил, что главный принцип - это "инвестиции только в российскую экономику: депозиты, недвижимость, облигации и так далее".
"Мы также планируем заниматься развитием религиозного туризма в России. Религиозный туризм является неосвоенной отраслью и очень интересной прежде всего для иностранцев. Это является одним из главных финансовых активов Церкви, мы хотели бы помочь развитию этой отрасли", - сказал он.
Л. Севастьянов призвал церковные структуры "перестраиваться на новый лад, жить не только пожертвованиями, а иметь какой-то свой источник дохода, который бы обеспечивал их независимость, прежде всего от бизнеса".
"На мой взгляд, каждый синодальный отдел Русской церкви должен озаботиться возможностью созданием эндаумент-фондов", - сказал он.
Л. Севастьянов добавил, что при создании фонда его учредители рассчитывают на пожертвования многих православных бизнесменов, в том числе тех, кто включен в "золотую сотню" журнала "Форбс".
Эндаумент-фонд - это целевой фонд пожертвований. Его отличие от других фондов заключается в том, что он создается для получения инвестиционного дохода, который будет использоваться для поддержания деятельности конкретной организации. Ссылки по теме: Каталог NEWSru.com:
Информационные интернет-ресурсы

description.hltext_display: Robot waiter service 'better than humans'
description.content:
SERVICE with a smile also comes with an electronic voice at the Dalu Robot restaurant, where the hotpot meals are not as famous yet as the staff who never lose their patience and never take tips. The restaurant, which opened this month in Jinan in northern Shandong province, is touted as China's first robot hotpot eatery where robots resembling Star Wars droids circle the room carrying trays of food in a conveyor belt-like system.
More than a dozen robots operate in the restaurant as entertainers, servers, greeters and receptionists. Each robot has a motion sensor that tells it to stop when someone is in its path so customers can reach for dishes they want.
The service industry in China has not always kept up with the country's rapid economic growth, and can be quite basic in some restaurants, leading customers in the Dalu restaurant to praise the robots. "They have a better service attitude than humans," said Li Xiaomei, 35, who was visiting the restaurant for the first time. "Humans can be temperamental or impatient, but they don't feel tired, they just keep working and moving round and round the restaurant all night." Inspired by space exploration, robot technology and global innovation, the restaurant's owner, Zhang Yongpei, said he hopes his restaurant will show the world China is a serious competitor in developing technology.
As customers enter the dimly lit restaurant lined with blinking neon lights to simulate a futuristic environment, a female robot decorated with batting eyelashes greets people with an electronic "welcome". During the meal, crowds of up to 100 customers, are entertained by a dancing and talking robot that looks more like a mannequin with a dress, flapping its arms around in a stiff motion.
Mr Zhang said he hopes to roll out 30 robots - which cost $6000 each - in the coming months and eventually develop robots with human-like qualities that serve customers at their table and can walk up and down the stairs.

Humans can be temperamental or impatient, but they don't feel tired, they just keep working and moving round and round the restaurant all night.

he hopes to roll out 30 robots - which cost $6000 each - in the coming months and eventually develop robots with human-like qualities that serve customers at their tableand can walk up and down the stairs

description.hltext_display: 海外赴任、ベトナムです。家族で行くか、単身か… - 日本人学校にいくのですか？
description.content:
はじめまして。
タイトルの通り主人の海外赴任がきまりベトナムになりました。
うちには小学校2年生と幼稚園児の二人の子供がいます。
会社は家族でも単身でもいいといわれていますので自分たちで決めていいのですがどうしたらいいのか悩んでいます。
だいたい3年といわれていますので小学生の子は5年生か6年生でこちらにもどることになりそうですが教育が十分な国なのかもわかりませんので不安です。
どなたかベトナムに駐在されたことのあるかたなどいろいろ教えていただけませんか？
家族でいくのか、単身か・・・それもお聞きしたいです。
いろいろアドバイスお願いします。

description.hltext_display: St. John's wins another inseason tournament
description.content:
St. John's wins another inseason tournament
Britain News.Net
NEW YORK -- Justin Brownlee scored a career-high 21 points and St. John's shot 80 percent from the field in the second half to beat previously undefeated Northwestern 85-69 on Tuesday night to win the Holiday Festival at Madison Square Garden.Dwight Hardy had 24 points and Justin Burrell added 17 for the Red Storm (7-3), who won the tournament for the 15th time in 45 appearances.St. John's outstanding shooting in the second half - 16 of 20 - complemented tenacious defensive performances from Brownlee and freshman Dwayne Polee II. John Shurna had 28 points and Drew Crawford added 17 for the Wildcats (8-1), who were trying to match their best start since 1993-94. They entered the game as one of the last nine unbeaten teams in Division I.Brownlee was assigned Shurna and Polee had Crawford...
Read the full story at The Miami Herald

description.hltext_display: South Korea moves drills to land border
description.content:
SOUTH Korea has vowed to "punish the enemy" as hundreds of troops, fighter jets, tanks and attack helicopters prepared massive new drills near the heavily armed border a month after a deadly North Korean artillery attack. Although the North backed down from its threat to retaliate over South Korean drills on Monday in waters of the west coast claimed by both countries, South Korean forces have been on high alert this week, warning of surprise attacks.
The North responded to a November 23 artillery drill on South Korea's front-line Yeonpyeong Island with an artillery bombardment that killed four, including two civilians.
The North has made some conciliatory gestures in recent days - telling a visiting US governor that it might allow international nuclear inspections of its atomic programs - but Seoul appears unmoved and is bracing for possible aggression. "We will completely punish the enemy if it provokes us again like the shelling of Yeonpyeong Island," Brigadier General Ju Eun-sik, chief of the army's 1st armored brigade, said.
South Korea's army and air force also planned joint firing drills tomorrow near the Koreas' land border.
The training - the 48th of its kind this year - will be the biggest-ever wintertime joint firing exercise that South Korea's army and air force have staged, the army said. The drill will involve 800 troops, F-15K and KF-16 jet fighters, K-1 tanks, AH-1S attack helicopters and K-9 self-propelled guns.
South Korea had planned to conduct only 47 drills of this type this year but decided to conduct one more because of continuing tension with North Korea, an army officer said on condition of anonymity citing department rules.
North Korea, meanwhile, indicated to visiting New Mexico Governor Bill Richardson that it was prepared to consider ways to work with the South on restoring security along the border.
Mr Richardson praised Pyongyang for refraining from retaliation and said his visit to the North provided an opening for a resumption of negotiations aimed at dismantling North Korea's nuclear program. North Korea pulled out of six-nation talks to provide Pyongyang with aid in exchange for disarmament in April 2009, but since has said it is willing to resume them.
The White House, however, rejected the idea, saying Pyongyang needed to change its "belligerent" behaviour first and was not "even remotely ready" for negotiations. In Seoul, a senior South Korean government official said the military would remain prepared for the possibility of a "surprise" attack in coming days. He spoke on condition of anonymity because of the sensitivity of the matter.
South Korea's Navy began annual four-day firing and anti-submarine exercises today off the country's less-tense east coast. The east coast was used by the North as a submarine route for communist agents to infiltrate South Korea in the past.

event_or_fact.property: We will completely punish the enemy if it provokes us again like the shelling of Yeonpyeong Island
his visit to the North provided an opening for a resumption of negotiations aimed at dismantling North Korea's nuclear program

description.hltext_display: 奉节：两个脐橙品牌喜获农业部“绿色认证”
description.content:
华龙网讯（特约通讯员毛世洲 高成国）笔者昨日从奉节县脐橙产业发展中心获悉，该县生产的“蜀东门脐橙”、“夔门白帝橙”两个脐橙品牌环境检测、产品检测化验均达到了国家绿色食品标准。，日前被国家农业部“中国绿色食品发展中心”正式认证为国家A级绿色食品。
据悉，“蜀东门脐橙”、“夔门白帝橙”是目前奉节县唯一获得绿色认证的两个脐橙产品。该认证的取得，标志着奉节脐橙按照国家食品安全生产标准，迈上了一个新台阶。同时由于绿色食品的价格高于普通无公害脐橙，这无疑将为当地果农增收，促进奉节脐橙标准化生产发挥极大的作用。

description.hltext_display: Let me Hear Your Heart Beat
description.content:
/PRNewswire/ -- What if monitoring your heart rate were as easy as listening to music while you jog? Thanks to advances in space technology, an iPhone will soon be able to do double duty: keep you in tune with your favourite artists and your vital signs.
With the support of ESA's Technology Transfer Programme (ESA TTP), Swiss company CSEM created the final prototype for their Pulsear device this year. A tiny unit embedded in a regular earphone uses infrared signals to see how fast your heart is beating. It sends infrared signals through the tissues in your ear. A tiny photo diode records the results and sends the information via the earphone wires to a device that plugs into your phone.
The result is an accurate reading of your heart rate, without the irritation of wearing a chest belt.
"Lots of people listen to music while they exercise and lots of people find the belts uncomfortable," said CSEM's Dr Andrea Ridolfi, "so we thought it made sense to measure heart rate through the ear."
Solution thanks to space-tech
Earlier attempts by CSEM to monitor heart rate using earphones were not satisfactory, said Dr Ridolfi, because the available technology was not sophisticated enough. But that was before CSEM developed a complex chest sensor for measuring astronauts' blood oxygen levels for ESA's Long Term Medical Survey system. "Once we were done," said Dr Ridolfi, "we said, 'let's recycle this'."
With a grant from the ESA TTP's 'Technology Transfer Demonstrator' initiative, CSEM created the prototype. The initiative supports development of new hardware and software to bridge the gap between the space technology and its terrestrial use.
An iPhone application shows your heart rate over time onscreen and compares, say, today's jog with last week's. Subjects who tested the app during their fitness training rated the device highly. While the current prototype measures only heart rate, future versions could easily be adapted to measure additional vital signs such as blood oxygen levels. This would open up a number of medical applications.
"Technology transfer from space has a huge potential to spur innovation in areas you wouldn't expect to find space-tech", explains Frank M. Salzgeber, Head of ESA TTP. "ESA TTP wants to help European industry to apply sophisticated space solutions to their markets."
Open Call for Technology Transfer Demonstrators: http://www.technology-forum.com/demonstrators/
More information: http://www.esa.int/ttp
Distributed by PR Newswire on behalf of European Space Agency

description.hltext_display: 川崎転勤！どこに住もう？情報お願いします。 - 川崎近辺に住んでます＆北海道出身です
description.content:
このたび、夫が川崎転勤が決まりそうです。
引っ越さなければならないのですが、私も夫も生粋の道民で、土地勘も全くありません。そして、ネットの住宅情報を見て、家賃の高さにビビっております。高いですね。
我が家は、夫＋私＋息子（年中）の３人家族です。
車があります。
最初の数年は家賃補助が出るみたいなのですが、それも数年でなくなります。
川崎駅が職場の場合、おすすめの居住地はありますか？
正直あまり裕福ではありません。
なので、高級な素敵な住宅地ではなくて、「庶民的だけど落ち着いた」場所を探しています。小学校から私立！というような財力がありませんので、あまりに公立学校が荒れてると心配です。
もう一つ、通勤が１時間以内で、乗り換えができるだけ少ないこと。
何しろ、現在が駅まで１０分乗車１０分徒歩５分の通勤なので、あまりにギャップが激しいと夫がキレてしまいそうです。
子育て支援は都内の方が充実してるらしい事も知りました。
ならば、稲城や府中に南武線で出るか（距離はあるけど乗り換えがない？）
それとも、住環境を求めて横浜市の住宅地を狙うか？？
？？？もう、わけがわかりません。
地図を見てみると、東京と横浜と川崎は隣接してるし、路線はたくさんあるし、道民の私はびっくりです。
ちなみに現在は、家賃８万円で3LDKのマンションに住んでます。
転勤後、家賃補助が７割でますが、数年でなくなります。
ですので、数年後を考えると、あまり贅沢な選択はできません・・
他の質問者様のように「予算１５万！」とかは先行きを考えると厳しいです。うーん。
ご助言お願いします。
ユーザーID：5455469893
お気に入り登録数：0
古いレス順
レス数：9本
タイトル
投稿者
平地に住みたい
2010年12月22日 12:00
北海道にお住まいの方なので、多分今は平地にお住まいと思います。
川崎市は多摩川に沿って縦長なのですが
多摩川から離れると丘陵地帯になります。
丘陵地帯って何？と疑問に思ってください。
標高６０〜７０メートルくらいのなだらかな山が続いています。
なので私の住んでいる所はどこに行くにも標高差３０メートルの坂を
登ったり下りたりしなければなりません。
すごくキツイです。
車があるから大丈夫？でも駐車場代が月１５０００円とかです。
私は歩くのも運転するのも坂道苦手なので
できたら平地に住みたかった〜〜〜と思っています。
すごい急な坂道で赤信号で止まらなくてはならない時
運転していて今でも緊張します。
けど社宅なので仕方ないです。
横浜も丘陵地帯が多いです。
なので南武線沿いの低地に住む事をおすすめします。
昔からの町が多いのでゴチャゴチャした下町風で
もしかしてガラが悪いと感じるかもしれませんが
昭和風の商店街があったりして私的には好みです。
ユーザーID：9859173421
あき
2010年12月22日 12:11
同僚や私の経験から…。
・南武線（武蔵新城・中原・府中など）
川崎まで１本なのと住環境の良さ・駅近マンションも充実から住む人多数。よく電車が止まり、東急との乗換駅は東京方面の利用者で混雑、駅前も雑然、家賃も高め。
・川崎駅周辺（幸区など）
自転車や徒歩で通勤でき、駅前商店街も味がある。駅直結のラゾーナもオシャレで便利。多摩川を臨む絶景マンションも。ただ環境的に子育て向きではない。家賃も高め。
・京浜東北・根岸線
川崎〜横浜間は駅から離れれば良い住宅街がある。川崎まで短時間で出られるので通勤の負担は殆どなし。
横浜〜磯子は住みづらい。
磯子〜大船間なら子育て世代に人気で住環境良好。家賃も安め。通勤時間は１時間ほどかかりますが、工夫すれば座れる。
・東海道線
激込み路線。辻堂あたりになるとのんびりした雰囲気。
・京急線
若干雰囲気がよくないが、能見台など南は良環境。
以上乗換なしの路線についてでした。なお各線とも海側はやめた方がいいです。
乗換アリだと、大田区は福祉も充実で子育て世代に最適、相鉄線も家賃が安くファミリー向けです。
ユーザーID：8489192499
GontaGo
2010年12月22日 12:28
川崎市に住んでますが、どこも住みやすいです。
川崎勤務でしたら、川崎市内に住まわれるのがよろしいかと思います。
横浜方面に行くと、住宅費がかかり、横浜を避けようとすると通勤距離が長くなります。
東京方面だとさらに住宅費は上昇します。
おすすめは、南部線沿線で探されること。
また、武蔵小杉、武蔵溝ノ口、登戸などの大きな駅のとなり駅（またはその隣）あたりを狙うと
比較的住みやすく、物価もそれほどではないので便利です。
良いところが見つかると良いですね。
ユーザーID：8016513416
ひとし
2010年12月22日 13:09
川崎の場合、臨港部は基本バスの移動になるので、新規に住むならば、川崎駅から南部に
住むより、東西（JR・京急）か北部（南武線沿線）を選択するのがいいでしょう。
ある程度落ち着いた住環境かつ家賃が安い所というと、武蔵新城あたりでしょうか。
（知っている人が、夫婦・赤ちゃんの３人で、昔賃貸で住んでいました。）
川崎駅の近くは下町ティストのやや雑多な感じがありますが、このあたりはNEC・富士通
等の大きな事業所が多くあり、そこの社員を想定した家族向けの物件も多くあります。
このあたりは、少し北に行くと高層マンションも建っている関係と地元では言っています
が（高所得者が定住したおかげと）、高津高校・洗足学園はそこそこ落ち着いたいい学校
として、地元には認知されています。
なお、溝の口（高津周辺）・登戸まで行くと、私鉄の利便性に影響されて家賃が上がり
ますが、今回は渋谷・新宿方向への通勤でないので、そこに住む必要はないでしょう。
また、武蔵新城から西の方面は野川ですが、ここは梶が谷・南武線のどの駅に行くにも
バスでしか移動できないので、JR南部線の駅周辺がいいでしょう。
ユーザーID：1686183105
ざきっこ
2010年12月22日 13:12
川崎在住です。
川崎は縦に長く、JR南武線がそれを縦断するように走っています。
同じ川崎でも川崎駅近辺に勤務するのか、武蔵小杉近辺なのか、
溝ノ口なのか、登戸なのか、新百合ヶ丘なのかで大分変わってきます。
そのへんの情報を出したほうがより的確なアドバイスがもらえると思いますよ。
私は新川崎というところに住んでいますが、治安は悪くありません。
ですが、最近電車の利便性がよくなり家賃があがりつつあります。
（2Kで10万強、駐車場は1.6万）。
電車で東京まで20分、横浜まで10分、川崎まで6分（バスで15分）、渋谷まで20分、新宿まで25分です（渋谷、新宿方面は電車が少ないですが）。
羽田空港も乗り継ぎがよければ、40分程度です。
ただ、高速道路が近くに走っていないので、車での長距離移動は面倒くさいです。
個人的に利便性だけ考れば、武蔵小杉ですかね。
家賃は高いですが、どこへ行くのも便利です。
川崎だったら、横浜に住居を構える選択もありかもしれませんよ。
子供はいないので、学校等の情報については他の方の回答をご参考に。
ユーザーID：7100319864
はむきち
2010年12月22日 13:32
はじめまして。
タイトルにもありますが第一優先は何でしょうか？
・教育(生活)環境 ・通勤 ・家賃
まず教育(生活)環境ですと、川崎市宮前区、横浜市青葉区・都筑区が良いと言われてます。
ただ実際は私が在住している区も治安が悪いと言われてますが、学校は全然荒れてませんよ。
通勤は基本上りとなるので電車は大変混みます。
最寄り駅までバス可能であれば家賃は下がってきますが徒歩ですとやはり高いです。
ちなみに上記に挙げた区は家賃は高めです。
通勤に便利で家賃も安くて環境もいい所はありません。
絶対譲れないものを教えて下さい。
ユーザーID：9674113207
mom
2010年12月22日 13:34
都民住宅みたいな建物で３ＬＤＫで築１７年ですが
９万円以内で借りれますよ。
駐車場も安く借りれます。
南多摩から徒歩１０分ぐらい山に向って歩くのがネックですが
お手頃価格のスーパー・銀行・郵便局が徒歩圏です。
駅近くには、市立病院・日帰り温泉・図書館もあります。
コメダもサイゼも徒歩圏。
緑も多くて町並みも、素敵です。
また、京王線稲城駅を利用して調布まで出ると
羽田行きのバスが頻繁に出てますので
北海道に帰ったりするのにも便利です。
このバスですが、羽田空港発・午後１１時代と０時代にも
あるので、飛行機が少々遅れても使えます。
ユーザーID：7868146574
ラビット
2010年12月22日 13:41
南武線で川崎から向河原のどこかにしません？。私はこの中のある駅の傍に実家が有ります。
地元ですので、あばたも笑窪となっちゃいますが、基本的に下町です。労働者の町です。凄いお金持ちは居ません（怒られるな）。その中でも、いくらか福祉がマシな川崎市に住める駅が良いと思います。
最近は、ご他聞に漏れず商店街の寂れ方が激しいのですが、それでも車を維持するなら充分にどこででも買い物が出来ます。食べられます。遊べます。
同じ南部沿線や他の鉄道路線と比べれば、駅から離れると家賃も極端に高くは有りません。流石に８万で３ＬＤＫは無いと思いますが、そもそもその額だと、駅からバスで２０分バス停から歩いて１０分とか言った場所でないと、通勤一時間圏には無いと思いますよ。
仕事で北海道の人とご一緒することが多いのですが、家賃や遠いのにラッシュがすごいのに辟易する人が多数です。この区間なら川崎まで１０分程度ですので、満員の蒸れ蒸れでもギリギリ耐えられると思います。
近隣の学校については、エ〜っと言う様な話も聞きます。まあ、それでも極端に荒れてるところは無いと思います。新参者にもキツクない地域ですよ。

description.hltext_display: Driver killed when car skids into tree
description.content:
A DRIVER has died after skidding in a pool of water while trying to overtake on a far north Queensland road. Police said the man was trying to overtake another vehicle when his sedan hit a mass of water, skidded off the roadway and hit a tree on Davidson Road, Euramo, near Innisfail about 3.45pm (AEST).
The man, believed to be in his 20s, died as a result of his injuries.
He was the only person in the car.
The death brings the state's holiday road toll to three.

description.hltext_display: Депутаты решили ограничить полномочия нового СК, поправив инициативу Медведева
description.content:
Государственная Дума приняла во втором чтении президентский законопроект " Российской Федерации", в текст которого внесли 119 поправок. После вступления закона в силу Следственный Комитет выйдет из системы прокуратуры, а возглавляющий его Александр Бастрыкин лишится приставки "исполняющий обязанности". Но полномочия будущего СК окажутся серьезно урезанными в сравнении с первоначальным текстом документа, отмечают СМИ. Наиболее примечательные цитаты из газет на эту тему приводит сайт Заголовки.ru.
Первоначальный вариант законопроекта не устраивал депутатов тем, что Следственный Комитет мог стать практически бесконтрольным органом, а следователи - неприкосновенными, напоминает газета "Коммерсант". (Издание ошибочно называет их "кастой неприкасаемых", хотя неприкасаемые - это не высшая, а низшая каста традиционного индийского общества). Исправленный вариант не устроил во вторник только фракцию КПРФ, которая подозревает, что теперь три правоохранительных ведомства - Генеральная Прокуратура, Следственный Комитет РФ и МВД - будут следить друг за другом, вместо того чтобы бороться с преступностью.
Камнем преткновения на обсуждении законопроекта стала одна из поправок, отклонения которой особенно настойчиво добивался сам Следственный Комитет. В поправке речь шла о праве прокуроров в порядке надзора истребовать уже закрытые дела из Следственного Комитета. Представители СК, находящиеся на связи с председателем думского комитета по конституционному законодательству Владимиром Плигиным ("Единая Россия"), утверждали, что вмешательство прокуроров внесет сумятицу в работу их ведомства. Депутаты в ответ на это возражали, так как дела закрыты, никаких проблем быть не должно.
Эксперты считают закономерным упорное нежелание следствия знакомить прокуроров с закрытыми делами: "Следователи не хотят отвечать за некачественное проведение следствия, подтасовки, ошибки, некомпетентность ? за все...", - сказал "Независимой газете" адвокат Генрих Падва. Член экспертного совета Государственной Думы по противодействию коррупции Дмитрий Горовцов считает, что эта поправка ? принципиальная с точки зрения контроля за деятельностью следователей. Эксперт полагает, что благодаря ей российская правоохранительная система избежала большой опасности.
Существенно переработали статью, в которой очень многие эксперты усмотрели неоправданное расширение полномочий следователей и потенциальную угрозу совсем уж бесстыжей коррупции, пишет "Московский комсомолец". Речь шла о праве следователей по предъявлении служебного удостоверения беспрепятственно проникать на территорию любых учреждений и организаций всех форм собственности и получать доступ к их документации даже без возбуждения уголовного дела.
Причем никаких оговорок, в каких именно случаях сотруднику СК можно пользоваться таким правом, в принятом в первом чтении документе не было, но теперь их прописали: беспрепятственно входить куда хочется следователю можно будет лишь при осуществлении ?процессуальных полномочий?, а именно - ?в целях проверки находящегося у следователя в производстве сообщения о преступлении или расследования уголовного дела?. Что касается жилых помещений или частных земельных участков ? туда можно входить лишь при пресечении преступления, преследуя преступника или при ?наличии достаточных данных полагать, что там совершено или совершается преступление?. ?Для оппозиции внесение этих поправок чрезвычайно важно, ведь не секрет, что у нас часто политическое преследование маскируется под уголовное преследование по экономическим или бытовым мотивам?, - сказал журналистам один из членов депутатской рабочей группы, зампред Комитета по безопасности, член партии ?Справедливая Россия? Геннадий Гудков. Ссылки по теме: Каталог NEWSru.com:
Информационные интернет-ресурсы

description.hltext_display: Road rage doctor could lose sports car
description.content:
A PERTH doctor convicted of road rage will soon learn whether his Alfa Romeo sports car will be permanently confiscated when a magistrate hands down his landmark verdict. Police want to seize the car belonging to Ala'A Mohammed Ali Al Rammahi who earlier this year pleaded guilty to reckless driving and was fined.
Angry a woman had beeped her horn at him, Mr Al Rammahi followed and repeatedly pulled in front of her car, traumatising her and her children.
Police are using a 2007 amendment to anti-hoon confiscation legislation that allows for vehicles to be seized for road rage offences.
Mr Al Rammahi, who owns two medical practices, is fighting the application, claiming he would suffer severe financial hardship if he lost his car, valued at between $17,000 and $20,000.
In the Perth Magistrates Court, Mr Al Rammahi's lawyer Max Crispe questioned the validity of the application.
He argued police technically erred by failing to give his client notice and issued the application without authority.
Prosecutor Mike Crook said the application should not be dismissed because it was made "in the spirit" of the legislation.
Magistrate Guiseppe Cicchini said the case could be the first of its kind and queries over errors with the application had to be resolved.
The court heard that the doctor had financial problems, including a defaulted loan on a multi-million dollar home. He also still owes about $6000 on his car.
Mr Crook asked Mr Al Rammahi how he expected to make repayments on his car because he had failed to make the past two. "I have not paid but (that) doesn't mean that I can't pay," he said. When pressed further, Mr Al Rammahi said: "Do you think I'm lying for $17,000?" In his closing submissions, Mr Crispe said his client unlikely to re-offend.
Magistrate Cicchini said he would have to consider the doctor's financial and physical hardship, and other relevant factors including the seriousness of the offence, before making his decision tomorrow.

event_or_fact.property: he would have to consider the doctor's financial and physical hardship, and other relevant factors including the seriousness of the offence, before making his decision tomorrow
I have not paid but (that) doesn't mean that I can't pay
police technically erred by failing to give his client notice and issued the application without authority
the case could be the first of its kind and queries over errors with the application had to be resolved
the application should not be dismissed because it was made "in the spirit" of the legislation
Do you think I'm lying for $17,000?

description.hltext_display: 一辆油罐车侧翻引起自燃 渝宜高速下奉节段关闭
description.content:
华龙网讯（通讯员 王艺颖 毛世洲）今日中午11时许，一辆满载汽油的油罐车在渝宜高速公路奉节段内侧翻后引发自燃，造成交通中断。
据了解，奉节县消防大队11：40分接警后，于11：50分到达事故现场。失火地点位于云阳到巫山高速下奉节路段3公里位置。现场发现，一辆满载汽油的油罐车发生交通事故后侧翻，导致车辆自燃。奉节县消防大队消防官兵到场后，发现火势非常猛烈，迅速向云阳和巫山两县的消防部门发起增援。半小时后，火势得到控制。
目前，因侧翻的油罐车还没调离，奉节县城通往渝宜高速公路的道路已经被临时封闭，预计下午4点才能通车。

description.hltext_display: Let me Hear Your Heart Beat
description.content:
/PRNewswire/ -- What if monitoring your heart rate were as easy as listening to music while you jog? Thanks to advances in space technology, an iPhone will soon be able to do double duty: keep you in tune with your favourite artists and your vital signs.
With the support of ESA's Technology Transfer Programme (ESA TTP), Swiss company CSEM created the final prototype for their Pulsear device this year. A tiny unit embedded in a regular earphone uses infrared signals to see how fast your heart is beating. It sends infrared signals through the tissues in your ear. A tiny photo diode records the results and sends the information via the earphone wires to a device that plugs into your phone.
The result is an accurate reading of your heart rate, without the irritation of wearing a chest belt.
"Lots of people listen to music while they exercise and lots of people find the belts uncomfortable," said CSEM's Dr Andrea Ridolfi, "so we thought it made sense to measure heart rate through the ear."
Solution thanks to space-tech
Earlier attempts by CSEM to monitor heart rate using earphones were not satisfactory, said Dr Ridolfi, because the available technology was not sophisticated enough. But that was before CSEM developed a complex chest sensor for measuring astronauts' blood oxygen levels for ESA's Long Term Medical Survey system. "Once we were done," said Dr Ridolfi, "we said, 'let's recycle this'."
With a grant from the ESA TTP's 'Technology Transfer Demonstrator' initiative, CSEM created the prototype. The initiative supports development of new hardware and software to bridge the gap between the space technology and its terrestrial use.
An iPhone application shows your heart rate over time onscreen and compares, say, today's jog with last week's. Subjects who tested the app during their fitness training rated the device highly. While the current prototype measures only heart rate, future versions could easily be adapted to measure additional vital signs such as blood oxygen levels. This would open up a number of medical applications.
"Technology transfer from space has a huge potential to spur innovation in areas you wouldn't expect to find space-tech", explains Frank M. Salzgeber, Head of ESA TTP. "ESA TTP wants to help European industry to apply sophisticated space solutions to their markets."
Open Call for Technology Transfer Demonstrators: http://www.technology-forum.com/demonstrators/
More information: http://www.esa.int/ttp
Distributed by PR Newswire on behalf of European Space Agency

description.hltext_display: No intention of toning down in 2011, Ford says
description.author: ANNA MEHLER PAPERNY
description.content:
Coming off successive victories at his first substantive council meeting, Mayor Rob Ford has reason to be pleased with himself: He has slain a personal vehicle tax and trimmed councillors budgets, has declared light-rail transit dead in its tracks and lacks only the provinces approval to remove transit workers right to strike. And he made it clear in an interview with The Globe and Mail Tuesday that he has no intention of toning it down as he heads into a new year. In 2011, hell have to conjure budget efficiencies his opponents say are impossible, construct brand-new transit plans to replace projects years in the making and confront the citys strongest unions. Mr. Ford said an auditors report due in January will vindicate what hes been saying for years about waste at city hall waste he still cant specify but which he has told city staff to find, to the tune of hundreds of millions of dollars, over the next several weeks. Theres something coming from the auditors office thats going to be pretty earthshaking. I cant tell you what that is right now, but theres a lot of waste, he said. Im not happy with what he found but he did his job and Ill have to deal with it. Neither Mr. Ford nor the citys auditor-general, Jeff Griffiths, would give details on the report, although Mr. Griffiths referenced last years audit into the citys downtown Peter Street shelter, which ended up costing twice as much as the city budgeted to purchase the former nightclub site. Were still in the middle of finalizing the report. Its a little premature at the moment, he said. The only discussion Ive had with the mayor is that there are a number of reports coming out that are going to be maybe problematic. If you take a look at reports weve done over the past couple of years, Peter Street, from our perspective, was extremely problematic, if you want to use that term. In the meantime, Mr. Ford insisted he can cut the hundreds of millions hell need to shave off the 2011 budget. He added to the budgets $221-million shortfall last week by ending the citys vehicle registration tax, which brought in about $64-million annually. Theres no sacred cows, he said. I want everything to be reviewed including the police, the $900-million service that is the largest line item in the citys operating budget. The forces salary costs would increase further if Mr. Ford is able to put another 100 officers on Torontos streets as he said hed like to do. In his pursuit of efficiencies, Mr. Ford isnt shying away from a battle with organized labour: He has vowed to pursue privatization for not only garbage but other city services, as well park maintenance, for example. Theres a lot of grass to be cut, he said, adding that hes willing to brave further strikes to do so. I expect people to come to work. And if they dont come to work, I have to do what I have to do. I hope it doesnt come to that. Same goes for the Toronto Transit Commission. City council voted by a margin of 28 to 17 to ask the province to designate transit an essential service even though many people, including the TTCs chief general manager, Gary Webster, and one of Mr. Fords own mentors, Doug Holyday, have said that would be a bad idea.
And Amalgamated Transit Union Local 113 president Bob Kinnear has said that denying transit workers the right to strike will guarantee more work to rule situations, in which transit vehicles might run only during rush-hour, for example. Well cross that bridge when we get to it, Mr. Ford said. And as for Transit City, Mr. Ford said hes prepared to put three of the four transit lines on hold if it means coming through on his promise of a subway along Sheppard Avenue. Sheppards the first one I want to do. Ive talked to the Premier about it, talked to Metrolinx about it. They know where I stand and theyve said it can be done. [Premier Dalton] McGuinty said he doesnt mind giving us the money if thats what we want to do with it. And we can build subways. Eventually, the mayor said, Im sure we can build the subways in the rest of the city. Its more expensive, but thats what the people want. Even if that means cancelling or postponing indefinitely rapid transit in his own former ward of Etobicoke North? They have transit, he laughed. It sounds like were we have transit. People get to the slots, they get to Woodbine racetrack, people get to Humber College. There are buses that run up there. Eventually, Id like to have subways running through the whole city. But what we can afford realistically, right now, is just Sheppard, right? Mr. Ford also dismissed the suggestion that monorails or a similar above-grade technology could replace light rail. Similar projects have been tried in Vancouver on the Canada Line, which opened this year. Theres no more above ground, he said. No, everythings going underground. I want to do subways. Every poll you see, over 80 per cent of people in the city want subways compared to LRT or streetcars. So Im going to do what I campaigned on.

Well cross that bridge when we get to it
hes willing to brave further strikes to do so.
I cant tell you what that is right now, but theres a lot of waste
denying transit workers the right to strike will guarantee more work to rule situations, in which transit vehicles might run only during rush-hour, for example.

description.hltext_display: 奉节：六个脐橙品牌可让市民一年有8个月鲜果吃
description.content:
华龙网讯（通讯员 毛世洲）笔者从奉节县脐橙产业发展中心获悉，该县正重点培育六个脐橙品牌支撑“八个月鲜果脐橙产业化工程”，市民可在一年中的8个月时间里吃到新鲜的奉节脐橙。
据悉，“奉节脐橙”品牌包括3个自主知识产权品种和3个晚熟专利品种：1953年从江津果树所引进、1972年县园艺场选出、果实成熟期12月份至次年1月份的“凤园脐橙”（原称奉园72-1脐橙）；1991年县园艺场从800万株72-1群体中选出的芽变单系、果实11月下旬成熟的“凤早脐橙”（原称奉园91脐橙）；1995年奉节县脐橙研究所从1000万株群体选出的晚熟芽变单系、果实次年2月下旬至3月份成熟的“风晚脐橙”（原称袁梁95-1）；2005年引进奉节于大洪村、果实次年4-5月份成熟的“鲍威尔脐橙”； 2006年引进奉节铁佛村、果实成熟期在3-4月份的“班菲尔脐橙”； 2005年引进奉节段坪村、果实成熟期在4-5月的“切斯勒特脐橙”。
奉节县脐橙产业发展中心表示，这六个品种将支撑该县实施“八个月鲜果脐橙产业化工程”，打造亚洲最大的晚熟脐橙基地、以及“中国橙都”白帝城特色生态旅游圣地，致富三十万人。

description.hltext_display: 名古屋転勤 - 先行レスがあります
description.author: tkdtkd
description.content:
稲沢に住んでます。名古屋まで通勤してますが、栄なら電車で30分ほどで着きます。
市内だと家賃の他に駐車場代が1万以上かかるので、稲沢に決めました。
夫婦2人暮らし2LDKで、家賃が8万円、駐車場代が5千円です。都会すぎず田舎すぎず住みやすいですよ。

description.hltext_display: Dickens on The Strand wasnt senior friendly
description.content:
I have been stewing since the Dickens on The Strand event. My husband and I retired here in Galveston in June. One of the first things we heard about was this December event, and we were told it was a must-see.
So, for six months, we anticipated the event and looked forward to going.
Finally the weekend arrived. We chose to go Saturday because of the potential weather conditions. All I can say is the Dickens on The Strand is not senior-citizen friendly.
Parking availability was atrocious. Every lot was charging ridiculous fees of $10 to $15. We finally found a spot that was “fee-less,” only later to find we were in a tow zone. The towing could have cost us $300 to redeem our vehicle. Even at that, we had a long walk to the main event.
Once we made it to the blocked-off area, we were shocked to find we would be required to pay $12 each just to get in and walk around. So this nice event for us was a bust.
It could have cost us $15 to park and another $24 just to get inside and look around. This does not even allow for anything we might have wanted to buy from a vendor. Yes, we now are among the fixed-income recipients. We have the time, the energy and the interest but find we are eliminated from many things due to cost and inconvenience.
So, at the entrance gate we turned around and headed straight back to our vehicle. As we approached many blocks later, we discovered it was next in line to be towed. Thank God we did not stay and pay to get in.
Dickens on The Strand for us would have been a back breaker and not just a dent in our pockets.
Needless to say, our future plans do not include any further downtown events. Forget Mardi Gras. We might go back for the Fourth of July. That event proved to be senior friendly. Parking was better then, too.
Its too bad that when a person can really take time and enjoy things, they can no longer afford them.
Galveston has a lot to offer ... if you have the money. We don’t.
Bobi Sanders lives in Galveston.

description.hltext_display: Councils accused of not learning lessons of last winter
description.author: Sion Morgan
description.content:
WELSH councils were last night accused of ignoring the lessons of last winter’s big freeze after figures showed they had ordered less gritting salt this year than last.
Thousands of road, rail and air travellers were the victims of continued transport disruption yesterday as the snow and freezing conditions continued.
The TaxPayers’ Alliance criticised councils for being unprepared and said that it was unacceptable to claim that extreme winters were now a rare event.
Eleven Welsh councils, including Cardiff, Gwynedd and Powys, were among those the campaign group said had ordered less salt so far this winter than last.
The group said that emergency orders during winter were more expensive and harder to get than stocking up during the summer.
Several of the local authorities defended their salt purchasing policy, arguing that it made sense to stagger purchases and they were expecting the figures to rise.
TaxPayers’ Alliance policy analyst Chris Daniel said: "Many councils were clearly unprepared for the latest icy spell, because they had ordered less salt than they did last year.
"It is unacceptable for councils to write off their failings by claiming that extreme winters in Britain are too rare an event for it to be worth preparing.
"This winter is the third in a row where severe weather has swept across the UK, so councils and highways agencies have no excuses for not having everything in place.”
He went on: "While some seem to have learnt from last year and ordered extra supplies for the current winter period, others have not.”
The TaxPayers’ Alliance highlighted Flintshire council, which ordered 10,000 tonnes of salt in total last year compared to just 4,700 in preparation for this winter.
Powys, hit hard by snow in recent weeks, ordered 31,000 tonnes last year but just 21,000 at the start of this seasonal period.
Wrexham ordered 7,940 tonnes in 2009-10 and 7,000 tonnes this year; Pembrokeshire 8,700 tonnes last year and 6,350 this year; Monmouthshire had 9,800 tonnes last year compared to 5,500 in 2010-11 and Cardiff 3,325 last year and 2,600 tonnes in advance of this winter.
A spokesman for Cardiff council said it was more efficient for the authority to purchase salt gradually.
He said the council is expecting a delivery of 1,300 tonnes next week which would take its stock this year to 4,200, above last year’s figure.
A spokesperson for Powys council said: "The figures released by the alliance are not comparing like with like, they are using last season’s full winter use with stock received so far, clearly we are at the start of the winter season and will be reordering on a regular basis.”
A spokesman for Wrexham council said the figure for this year had been calculated differently to last year.
Gwynedd council has also stated that, although less salt was ordered this year, it is also expecting this year’s figure to rise.
Steve Thomas, of the Welsh Local Government Association, revealed yesterday that the country may only have enough salt left to last a few days.
He said: "The supply is dwindling and people are trying to stretch it out.
"The problem is that it’s a European-wide problem but there is no point pretending that the stocks are not running down very quickly.”
Andy Ratcliffe, forecaster at MeteoGroup, said a band of snow which developed last night through Wales and the Midlands would bring the possibility of further snow flurries further south before it clears.
"There’s still a lot of snow on the ground and it’s not going to disappear quickly,” he said.
"Temperatures will stay cold so there will not be a rapid thaw.
"The cold spell will keep its grip on the country at least until the weekend.”
One of the coldest temperature in the UK recorded in the early hours of yesterday morning was -15.4°C (4°F) at Capel Curig in Gwynedd.
A severe weather warning for Pembrokeshire was issued by the Met Office yesterday.
There were reports of heavy snow and disruption on the A487 between Solva and St Davids, where 10-15cm fell.
Heavy snow also affected the south of the county at Milton and St Ishmaels.
Heavy snow showers were forecast throughout the night.
Only main routes continued to be gritted until salt stocks can be replenished.
A spokesman for Pembrokeshire council said: "There is no gritting of secondary and minor highway routes and requests for reactive gritting will not be attended. Requests for an emergency response will be prioritised as resources permit.”
The RAC said calls for assistance peaked at 1,800 an hour and advised motorists to take steps to help prevent experiencing problems with their cars as temperatures plummet overnight.
Although some rail services were delayed or cancelled, the situation regarding buses was improving.
Veolia Transport said all its services were now running – Cardiff to and from Pontypridd, Bridgend, Caerphilly, Vale of Glamorgan and Aberdare.
First Cymru said it was attempting to run as normal a service as possible in Swansea, Neath and Port Talbot, but many buses were sticking to main roads only.
Traffic Wales said hazardous conditions were reported on various main routes, including almost the whole length of the M4 in Wales.
Flights were resumed from Cardiff Airport but there was continued disruption at Heathrow, Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow, as well as Gatwick, Luton and London City airports.
Prime Minister David Cameron said he was frustrated by the continued disruption at Heathrow as the Government offered military support to help clear the snow.
He said: "If it’s understandable that Heathrow had to close briefly, I’m frustrated on behalf of all those affected that it’s taking so long for the situation to improve.
"There have been intensive discussions between [Transport Secretary] Philip Hammond and BAA about how best to ensure that normal flying capacity is resumed as soon as possible.”
British Airports owner BAA said the second runway at Heathrow was opened at 5pm yesterday.

event_or_fact.property: Many councils were clearly unprepared for the latest icy spell, because they had ordered less salt than they did last year.
If it?s understandable that Heathrow had to close briefly, I?m frustrated on behalf of all those affected that it?s taking so long for the situation to improve.
The supply is dwindling and people are trying to stretch it out.
he was frustrated by the continued disruption at Heathrow as the Government offered military support to help clear the snow

description.hltext_display: '3G in India: Operator Launch Strategies' and Other Research Reports by Ovum Available at MarketPublishers.com
description.content:
LONDON, Dec. 22, 2010 /PRNewswire/ -- Market Publishers Ltd informs that new in-demand market research reports by Ovum have been added to its catalogue. . The report describes data services targeted at specific market segments, provides the key to faster returns on network investments. description.hltext_display: 教えてください 京都 大晦日～お正月 - とりあえず
LM mayor should get her facts correct
description.content:
Dear residents and business owners of La Marque:
I apologize for what you have endured these last several months with all that is going on in our city. I will vow that we will continue to do what is right regardless of what political side we are on.
I have kept silent for the sake of taking the high road of professionalism; however, Mayor Geraldine Sam wrote a guest column Tuesday, and I can’t continue to let her use my name for the sake of pushing her agenda.
Residents, the mayor said we are going broke.
We are not broke.
According to our auditor, we had one of the best audits that the city has received in years. Our monthly revenues generally run around $1 million, and we have exceeded that.
We have a great team in place to prevent water theft, the court’s revenue is up, we received a credit from worker’s comp because our injuries are down, and our employee insurance did not go up for the first time in history.
If we were broke, we wouldn’t be working to repair nearly 50 roads in the city, making payroll and providing professional services that we continue every day.
The mayor stated I used the city credit card for personal expenses. I never have. The city credit card was at its limit only once because of Texas Municipal League Conference registration, hotel and airline expenses for Geraldine Sam, Connie Trube and me, in addition to other business expenses for that month. The credit limit is low.
Excessive absence of more than 60 days is not true. I have used 17.75 days in earned comp time and 7.75 days in vacation time. That equals to only 25.5 days.
My previous employer did not fire me; I resigned to pursue another opportunity.
The contract was voted on and passed by a majority of city council. If fired or let go, then the manager would be paid out the remaining of the contract.
As the contract nears the maturity date, then the payout becomes smaller; $10,000 to assist in a job search only was a negotiating item in the contract. I am a natural negotiator; the mayor failed to negotiate.
The investigation into the fire department was only $24,888 and not $77,000 as she reported. The $77,000 was for attorney fees for all departments and assistance with the many open records request the mayor and her followers have done.
It is true the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission is free to the employee, but not to the city when defending itself.
It is not free if the EEOC levied fines and penalties if it found the city did something wrong or failed to act. The employees came to their employer with their complaints and not to the EEOC.
I would be doing a disservice to this city if I referred them to the EEOC and not take care of the problem once I became aware.
A vendetta against the fire department is false.
Holding it accountable is true.
Residents, please see our website at www.ci.la-marque.tx.us and go to the Financial Transparency Reporting section.
We have gold status by the Comptroller Leadership Circle of being financial transparent. You can view for yourself all checks and moneys being spent.
Eric W. Gage is city manager of La Marque.

event_or_fact.property: a guest column Tuesday, and I can?t continue to let her use my name for the sake of pushing her agenda
